fields.consult_intro:
<section>
At The Law Offices of Grinberg & Segal, PLLC, we offer New York and New Jersey divorce consultations with our expert family law attorneys.
</section>
<section>
We offer three types of consultations with our expert family law attorneys.  We offer two types of paid consultations.  First, we offer a 45-minute general family law consultation for a very reasonable $160.  Second, we offer a 15-minute uncontested divorce consultation for only $49.  Finally, we offer 15-minute free consultations for domestic violence victims..  If you are not sure whether a consultation is right for you, please use our free “Ask a Question” feature to tell us a little bit about your situation and learn more about how our experienced New York and New Jersey family law attorneys can assist you.
</section>
<section>
Our 45-minute general consultation is generally sufficient for us to gain a full understanding of your unique case.  We find that 15-minute consultations almost always give us enough time to understand your New York and New Jersey uncontested divorce cases.  Finally, our 15-minute free consultations for domestic violence victims give us the opportunity to gain a preliminary understanding of the case and help you determine how to move forward. 
</section>
<section>
In order to best make use of your consultation time, we ask you to answer a few simple questions on the consultation request form and provide us with  information relevant to your case before beginning your consultation (again, if you are unsure which consultation best suits your situation, please try our free “Ask a Question” form first).  Please notify us if you also have immigration issues to discuss with our firm.  You may learn more about our immigration practice and services at myattorneyusa.com. Before submitting the consultation form, make sure that you have filled it out accurately and that you have carefully read our terms and conditions.  We are bound by law to preserve complete confidentiality of your information.  For this reason, your information will never be shared with third parties.
</section>
<section>
Upon receipt of your request, we will contact you by your chosen method within 48 hours to schedule your consultation or address any questions that we have before proceeding. 
</section>
<section>
The consultation fee is payable prior to the start of the consultation. We accept the payment of the fee by all major credit cards.  In order to make a payment, you must use our secure payment portal.  You must complete the payment information in order to schedule your consultation.
</section>
<section>
Please note that our attorneys only handle family law cases in New York and New Jersey.  Our immigration law division handles cases in all 50 states and at U.S. consulates abroad. 
</section>
fields.agreement:
<section>
Your Online legal consultation (“consultation”) with The Law Offices of Grinberg and Segal, P.L.L.C. (hereinafter referred to as the “Firm”), is subject to the following terms and conditions.
</section>
<section>
Prior to the legal consultation, we need to identify all parties involved in your situation. Identification of all parties involved is necessary so that we may assess whether there is a conflict of interest preventing the attorney from providing you with a legal consultation. Please note that the quality of the consultation depends, in large measure, on the accuracy of the information you provide on this consultation form. The more precise and reliable the information you provide the more specific and useful the consultation will be.
</section>
<section>
PLEASE NOTE
</section>
<section>
============
</section>
<section>
Your request for an online consultation creates only a limited attorney-client relationship, which terminates at the completion of the consultation. The consultation is not intended to and does not under any circumstances, create an on-going attorney-client relationship.  The said limited attorney-client relationship created by the online consultation exists  for the sole purpose of providing advice during the consultation and only with respect to the questions posed.  As such, unless the Firm  agrees to represent you and you enter into  a written agreement with the Firm, manually signed by one of the Firm's attorneys, neither the attorney providing the answer or consultation nor the Firm is or shall be your attorney-of-record in any pending matter. 
</section>
<section>
PLEASE UNDERSTAND
</section>
<section>
===================
</section>
<section>
In order to formally engage the Firm you would need to request a written Retainer Agreement from the Firm, execute the Agreement by manually signing and initialing it in all appropriate places, and return it to the Firm by regular mail, and not via email or any other form of electronic communication. Upon receipt by the Firm, the Retainer Agreement will be reviewed and manually signed by the Firm's designated attorney, thus completing the execution of the Agreement. Once the Retainer Agreement is fully executed, you will be provided a copy of the Retainer Agreement and the Firm will keep the original Retainer Agreement in your file with the Firm. You are not a client of the Firm until the Retainer Agreement is fully executed by both you and the Firm and you have paid any requisite retainer fee to the Firm, when applicable.  At that point you are a client of the Firm and a formal lasting attorney-client relationship exists. Such relationship shall then continue until terminated by either you or the Firm in accordance with the terms of the Retainer Agreement.
</section>
<section>
PLEASE FURTHER NOTE
</section>
<section>
===================
</section>
<section>
At times, the law may require you to take action within a specified period of time or you will  lose your rights to file for said relief or other benefit to which you may be entitled under the law.  This firm will not be responsible for compliance with any such deadline, unless the Firm has been formally engaged in the manner explained above and you have previously provided all necessary and accurate information to the Firm that is required for the action.
</section>
